doc.field: Series II. Prints from the Olds Collection Donated by White & Case
Series II. Prints from the Olds Collection Donated by White & Case
Irving S. Olds collection of naval and other historical prints and related papers
Irving S. Olds collection of naval and other historical prints and related papers

W&C Inventory No. 355. Lithograph, colored: "The High Bridge at Harlem, N.Y. This magnificent bridge of stone forms a part of the immense works erected to bring the water of the Croton river to the City of New York. The length of the aqueduct from the Croton river to the City Hall is 44 1/4 miles and cost about $13,000,000. Length 1450 ft. Height 114 ft."
